items.sentence: Tom wished Mary had told him that she wasn\'t going to the party.
Tom would be terribly disappointed if we didn\'t go to his party.
Tom\'s apartment is within walking distance of the train station.
I ate some Greek food at a nearby restaurant just a few days ago.
Tell Tom I\'ll meet him at 2:30 in the lobby of the Hilton Hotel.
I found the work easy, since I had done that kind of work before.
I had to read this three times before I understood what it meant.
I wasn\'t surprised when Tom told me you didn\'t have to do that.
When I grow up, I\'m going to be a pilot. What do you want to be?
When you\'ve finished reading that book, could you lend it to me?
Why don\'t you call Tom and remind him about the party on Friday?
I just don\'t want you to do something that you\'ll be sorry for.
I wish that Tom wouldn\'t keep telling everyone I\'m his brother.
Let\'s grab a quick lunch at that small coffeeshop near the park.
Love alone isn\'t enough for a successful international marriage.
Next February, I\'ll be going to Australia for one year to study.
Tom was really glad to hear that Mary was going to help him move.
Tom went to his room, changed into his pajamas, and got into bed.
Do you think Tom has any chance of being elected class president?
Even though Tom had promised to pay, he stuck Mary with the bill.
I think you know Tom isn\'t going to do that unless you help him.
Since the note was written in French, it was easy for me to read.
The problem is all parents wants their children to go to Harvard.
Tom can still play the piano even though he doesn\'t own one now.
Tom can\'t have that, but he can have anything else on the table.
Tom certainly didn\'t expect to inherit the house from his uncle.
Tom certainly didn\'t let anyone know that he was arriving today.
Tom eats lunch at the school cafeteria two or three times a week.
Tom is a little older than the rest of the students in his class.
Tom made a lot of money in Boston and then moved back to Chicago.
Tom was caught cheating on the exam and was expelled from school.
Tom was much taller than I was when we were in elementary school.
Tom was sad because he was the only one not invited to the party.
Tom was sitting at his desk, flipping through an old photo album.
Tom was stabbed and died before they could get him to a hospital.
Tom woke up the children and told them it was time for breakfast.
I can\'t be in the same room as Tom without getting into a fight.
I can\'t believe how much things have changed since we were kids.
I can\'t think of a good reason why we should give Tom any money.
I changed my mind about dinner. I\'m not really hungry right now.
Tom might bleed to death if we don\'t get him to a hospital soon.
I didn\'t need to understand French to know that they were angry.
I didn\'t want to drink any wine, but Tom made me drink a little.
I didn\'t want to go to Boston last weekend, but I had no choice.
I didn\'t want to spend any more time cleaning the kitchen floor.
I don\'t have enough time to do everything that needs to be done.
I don\'t know when Tom got married, but I do know he got married.
Tom almost never forgets to send his mother a Mother\'s Day card.
I thought you said you knew Tom might have to do that by himself.
I was surprised when Tom said he was planning to go to Australia.
